iati-activity.title: Police Liaison Officer
iati-activity.description: Continue providing focus, coherence and clarity to the UK law enforcements operational engagement with the Ghana Police Service, EOCO and Attorney Generals Office. Strengthen capacity and share best practice within the Ghanaian Criminal Justice System.

iati-activity.title: Changing Mindsets
iati-activity.description: To sensitise the Ghanaian public against irregular migration by highlighting its dangers, through a 45 minute documentary to be broadcast on 3 major Ghanaian televisions followed by mobile cinema campaigns within all of Ghanas ten regions.

iati-activity.title: Police Liaison Officer-Provision of in-country costs for the PLO October 2013- March 2014, continuation of project delivery within the criminal justice system that will deliver sustainable improvements in local capabilities.
iati-activity.description: The project covers the in-country costs of the Police Liaison Officer, who oversees a number of other projects aimed at building the capacity of the Ghana Police and related agencies, and who provides liaison between UK and Ghanaian law enforcement agencies.

iati-activity.title: Advocacy and Empowerment on LGBT Rights
iati-activity.description: To increase the capacity of advocates (including state organisations and CSOs) to advocate for the rights of LGBT persons in Ghana. To empower members of the LGBT community to enforce their rights by arming them with information and strategies for rights protection.

iati-activity.title: Policy Dialogue - Global
iati-activity.description: Development of skills and leadership in the creative sector overseas

iati-activity.title: Sub-Saharan Africa New Connections - ODA
iati-activity.description: Development of skills and leadership in the creative sector overseas
Reclaiming degraded land and reforesting with cash crops like citrus and teak will protect the environment and afford residents alternative sources of livelihood.
iati-activity.title: Reclaiming of Land in the Akim Communities in the Eastern part of Ghana
Promoting electoral and peace education and the participation of vulnerable and marginalised groups in the 2012 elections.
iati-activity.description: This project seeks to promote education and sensitization among people at the local level on the electoral rules and regulations including the voting processes so as to reduce spoilt ballot boxes and also undertake peace campaign initiatives.

iati-activity.title: Managing Political and Administrative Transitions: The British Experience.
iati-activity.description: The project brought in an expert from the UK to share his experience in handling transitions. The expert led a private seminar for relevant figures from the Ghanaian civil service on the role of the civil service in governmental transitions, followed by a public lecture on the same subject.
Frontline diplomacy in support of UK aid flows to Ghana
iati-activity.title: Aid related diplomacy Accra
Sustainability of National Peace during the 2012 elections.
iati-activity.description: To introduce to the target group (the Zongo youth; men and women), the non-violence teachings of religion, peace building and democratic credentials and to educate the target group on the electoral processes and understand the essence of conducting free and fair elections.

iati-activity.title: Coming Home to Ghana Guide for returnees
iati-activity.description: The coming home booklet provides information on available support services and service inquiry procedures for Ghana migrants returning from the United Kingdom. The booklet ensures potential migrants are sufficiently prepared and can make informed choices when they plan their journey home with information on available support services and options. This in the end will ensure the successful social and economical reintegration of the returnees.

iati-activity.title: Strengthening the institutional capacity of Ghana Immigration Service (GIS) to effectively manage migration in the national interest.
iati-activity.description: Strengthening the institutional capacity of Ghana Immigration Service (GIS) to effectively manage migration in the national interest.
To train 100 of unemployed youth - 55 male and 45 female in basketry, carving, leather works, batik, tie and dye, ceramics and pottery and bamboo works, to enable them earn a decent livelihood.
iati-activity.title: Youth Capacity Building Project
Empowering Teenage girls on their sexual and reproductive rights in Mining communities
iati-activity.description: To empower girls between the ages of 10 to 19 on their sexual and reproductive health rights to reduce the high rates of sexual violence and unwanted pregnancy and in Western and Ashanti Regions

To observe at first hand the Biometric Voter Registration (BVR) exercise and interact with Electoral Commission officials, regional officers and party agents about the challenges and successes they have experienced with the process. iati-activity.title: International Leaders Programmme - February 2014 Visit
iati-activity.description: Comprises a visit to the UK which promotes the development of future leaders from various sectors and countries. Participants gain a deeper understanding of the UK, new contacts including through meetings and discussions with UK leaders in business, politics, academia and others. Programme builds a network of leaders from the emerging powers, and includes sustained and targeted follow up by UK posts and alumni team in London to build long-term exchange of ideas and knowledge (accommodation, travel and conference costs are paid for by the UK).

iati-activity.title: Project Support Officer
iati-activity.description: The Support Officers work frees up the PLO and CJA to utilise their specialist skills more fully. The PLO and CJA are specialist posts requiring particular expertise. The aim is to relieve them of non-specialist tasks so as to ensure greater impact in Police and Justice capacity building.
